title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 July 2016 - XWiki
content:
<lkrejci> has quit  
00:17 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
00:19 <marcules> has quit  
01:07 <lkrejci> has quit  
01:13 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
03:10 <lkrejci> has quit  
05:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:58 <D-Spair> has quit  
07:01 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
07:31 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:01 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <msmeria> has quit  
08:22 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <mflorea> has quit  
09:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <vmassol> acotiuga: good morning  
09:18 <acotiuga> good morning  
09:18 <vmassol> do you think you could check why the test for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/Contrib%20-%20Meeting%20Application/ is failing today?  
09:18 <acotiuga> Sure, I'm preparing another commit on the application  
09:18 <vmassol> ok thanks  
09:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <mflorea> has quit  
09:25 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <vmassol> @acotiuga: e the home page tour, the second step (panels) should also highlight the right panels IMO and not just the left ones. WDYT? Could be an improvement for after 8.2 if it's risky  
09:42 <vmassol> maybe it requires some update to the tour app which may not support this use case?  
09:43 <evalica> vmassol: we cannot do that - we tried, there is a bug http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/TOUR-33  
09:43 <vmassol> Small detail: I'd use "breadcrumb'" and not "breadcrumbs" since I think we refer to it as the "breadcrumb"  
09:44 <evalica> vmassol: the pattern is using plural, see http://ui-patterns.com/patterns/Breadcrumbs  
09:44 <acotiuga> Bootstrat tour does not support the display/highlight of multiples elements in the same step. I can use a selector like #leftPanels, #rightPanels but then will end up with both panel sections highlighted, each of them having own description (which will be duplicated information in page)  
09:44 <vmassol> ok so we need to fix this first. Maybe then modify the text to mention left and right panels  
09:44 <vmassol> evalica: I've checked wikipedai and they use both. I'v never heard us use plural  
09:45 <evalica> well in the story of Hansel and Gretel :) they use multiple :)  
09:45 <vmassol> because they are bread crumbs  
09:45 <vmassol> not bbreadcrumb which doesn't meant bread crumbs ;)  
09:45 <vmassol> my point  
09:45 <evalica> well it's the base story for the pattern  
09:46 <vmassol> is that I don't see why we'd document something with a different name from the one we sue  
09:46 <vmassol> \*use  
09:46 <evalica> because it's the standard one  
09:46 <vmassol> who's the authority on that?  
09:46 <vmassol> I see as much singular than plural  
09:47 <evalica> well regarding UIX I gave you a link, I can find multiple books using plural when talking about the pattern  
09:47 <evalica> \*UX  
09:47 <vmassol> actually your links says somethinge lse  
09:47 <vmassol> quoting:  
09:47 <vmassol> " The breadcrumb at linux.com describes the depth of the hierachy you have indulged in."  
09:48 <vmassol> it says breadcrumbs plural in the title because it's talking generically  
09:48 <vmassol> " • The label of the current page is at the end of the breadcrumb and is not linked.  
09:48 <vmassol> "  
09:48 <vmassol> so I don't agree with you  
09:49 <Enygma`> https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2009/03/breadcrumbs-in-web-design-examples-and-best-practices/  
09:49 <vmassol> this pages talks about sinfaulr  
09:49 <vmassol> singular  
09:49 <Enygma`> breadcrumb = one element in the breadcrumbs control  
09:49 <vmassol> did you read what I pasted?  
09:49 <vmassol> " The breadcrumb at http://linux.com/ describes the depth of the hierachy you have indulged in."  
09:49 <vmassol> this is not about a single element  
09:49 <martinus-> Hello everybody ! Is someone can help me with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13348 ?  
09:50 <vmassol> second link you just ggave  
09:50 <vmassol> What is a breadcrumb? https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2009/03/breadcrumbs-in-web-design-examples-and-best-practices/#what-is-a-breadcrumb  
09:50 <vmassol> "A “breadcrumb” (or “breadcrumb trail”) is a type of secondary navigation scheme that reveals the user’s location in a website or Web application"  
09:50 <vmassol> so no you're wrong apparently :)  
09:50 <evalica> out text say: "Breadcrumbs" - correct; "The breadcrumbs allow you to identify where your page is located and navigate the hierarchy." - correct  
09:50 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <vmassol> the two links you gave me just prove what I said  
09:50 <vmassol> fun :)  
09:51 <evalica> so not sure what is the problem  
09:51 <vmassol> the right term is singular when you talk about the control  
09:51 <evalica> no  
09:52 <vmassol> if you talk about the various single elements of the breadcrumb then you can use plural  
09:52 <vmassol> but the overall control is singular  
09:52 <Enygma`> you never use just "breadcrumb" because it does not make sense. What you can use is "breadcrumb navigation" (i.e. breadcrumb-based navigation) or "breadcrumb trail" (i.e. a trail of multiple breadcrumbs). In both cases, it is always about a multitude of breadcrumbs (i.e. multiple breadcrumb elements). To simplify, we could use "breadcrumbs", but never just "breadcrumb".  
09:52 <vmassol> Enygma`: I've just quoted from Caty's links :)  
09:52 <vmassol> "A “breadcrumb” (or “breadcrumb trail”) is a type of secondary navigation scheme that reveals the user’s location in a website or Web application"  
09:53 <martinus-> I find very strange that the issue mentioned above doesn't appear in JIRA's 'my open issues'  
09:53 <vmassol> anyway I'm going to stop here. Just know that I prefer breadcrumb because that's what we've always use and there's enough litterature to see that it's not wrong  
09:54 <vmassol> martinus-: hi  
09:54 <martinus-> hi vmassol  
09:54 <vmassol> indeed that would be strange :)  
09:55 <vmassol> regarding the issue hte best person to help you with is Caleb who wrote this porter  
09:55 <vmassol> (cjd here when he's online)  
09:55 <martinus-> Yes I know, and there is a thread on the ML but I can't get a clear answer  
09:55 <martinus-> So I'm open to any workaround at this point  
09:58 <martinus-> I've just assigned the issue to Caleb :)  
09:58 <martinus-> even if I don't like to assign issue to anyone myself  
09:58 <vmassol> not a good practice ;)  
09:58 <vmassol> yep  
09:58 <vmassol> better to ping him or send a mail on the list  
09:58 <vmassol> he'll see it if he has time  
09:59 <vmassol> if not it means he doesn't have the time to work on this  
09:59 <martinus-> ...  
10:00 <martinus-> well.  
10:01 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:01 <martinus-> I just ping him, again  
10:02 <vmassol> on the list?  
10:02 <martinus-> directly and on the list  
10:02 <vmassol> ouch  
10:02 <vmassol> that's really bad form to ping people directly  
10:02 <vmassol> :(  
10:04 <martinus-> vmassol, I'm not perfect, I had a glitch this time sorry about it  
10:04 <vmassol> np  
10:05 <vmassol> the reason I mentioned it is just for you to know  
10:06 <vmassol> basically you get free product and free support but at least the devs should be able to decide if and when they want to respond (since this is done for free). For guaranteed response, there are professional services. that's the logic.  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <martinus-> I know, I know. this being said I havent been rude either  
10:08 <vmassol> no you're not :)  
10:09 <martinus-> I'm waiting for an answer since April so... Well... I'm a bit stuck  
10:09 <vmassol> I understand  
10:09 <vmassol> you could go back to DB mode  
10:09 <vmassol> remove the attachments  
10:09 <vmassol> switch to FS mode  
10:09 <vmassol> and attach them agian  
10:13 <evalica> has quit  
10:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <martinus-> vmassol, the point is I need to extract the attachments from the DB to have in on disk, nothing can do that but the FS porter  
10:16 <vmassol> what I said would work  
10:16 <vmassol> it's just redious  
10:16 <vmassol> \*tedious  
10:16 <vmassol> the point of the porter is to make it less tedious :)  
10:17 <martinus-> well, tedious is not the word when you have to move 5Go of image and documents :)  
10:17 <vmassol> AFAIK people have had success with it in the past so I don't know why it's failing now for oyu  
10:17 <vmassol> indeed  
10:17 <vmassol> in that case it's not really practicable  
10:18 <vmassol> I don't have a solution sorry. Someone (you?) need to read the porter script, debug it and fix the problem if any  
10:18 <vmassol> whoever that person is must spend some time do it  
10:19 <vmassol> if this is urgent and business-related, I can suggest that you contact xwiki sas (http://xwiki.com). They offer professional services and they probably give you a quote for doing it for you  
10:19 <martinus-> vmassol, well I've tried and spent time on reading, but it's a bit harsh to me and I'm almost sure I would take no more than 10min for Caleb to tell me what I should do/fix in the code  
10:19 <vmassol> k  
10:19 <martinus-> I'm going to try agazin  
10:19 <vmassol> let's see what he says when he's availa  
10:19 <vmassol> \*available  
10:20 <martinus-> and about pro support, we stopped it some time ago, and the "money" is now spent on the RT editor (if you don't know this yet :P )  
10:20 <vmassol> @acotiuga: re the restart tour button  
10:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <martinus-> we decided to stop the pro support because... most of the time we can get ourself fixed on our own  
10:21 <vmassol> martinus-: ah ok, no didn't know you're part of this :)  
10:21 <acotiuga> vmassol: WDYM ?  
10:21 <vmassol> would have been useful in this case :)  
10:21 <vmassol> acotiuga: it restarts at the last step  
10:21 <vmassol> (not the first one)  
10:21 <vmassol> "would have been useful in this case " was for martinus-  
10:22 <vmassol> ;)  
10:23 <martinus-> vmassol, "maybe" :)  
10:24 <martinus-> enough talk, now I get into the code once again :)  
10:25 <vmassol> sorry, I don't have the time to dive into this code myself. Good luck and let's hope caleb will be available soon  
10:26 <martinus-> yep , thanks vmassol  
10:27 <vmassol> mflorea1: we might need to mention in the RN of CK/XWiki that the users needs to force refresh their browser cache if they install the CKEditor extension. I've just done it and it was failing by default until I refreshed my cache  
10:28 <martinus-> vmassol, just you to know, the pro support once told us that only the extensions with "XWiki Development Team" as author were supported ...  
10:28 <vmassol> sure, it depends what support you take though  
10:28 <vmassol> and what extensions we're talking about  
10:28 <martinus-> vmassol, so if the author is Caleb, it's not namely the "XWiki Development Team"  
10:28 <vmassol> this one is developed by someone from xwiki sas  
10:28 <vmassol> so it's possible to support it IMO  
10:29 <mflorea1> vmassol: sure, we can, but that's true for any extension that has js (as long as you had a previous version installed and as long as we don't version the resource URLs)  
10:29 <vmassol> if it's an extension developed by someone else from the community it's harder and would cost me  
10:30 <mflorea1> right now clearing the browser cache is mandatory after an XWiki upgrade  
10:30 <vmassol> mflorea1: I know, just rtying to find ways to make it slightly easier for users. Although I koow not many will read the RN  
10:30 <vmassol> mflorea1: I never do this  
10:30 <vmassol> and bot many people do IMO  
10:30 <vmassol> until you find a bug  
10:30 <vmassol> and then if you're experienced, you'll try this ;)  
10:30 <vmassol> we could put it in our general upgrade notes though  
10:30 <mflorea1> yes  
10:30 <vmassol> I'm pretty sure it's not there  
10:32 <martinus-> vmassol, that's perfectly normal, I just want to point out that "Caleb" is not publicly known as "XWiki Development Team".  
10:33 <martinus-> from a customer pov  
10:34 <vmassol> yep  
10:35 <vmassol> this extension is not supported by the xwiki dev team  
10:35 <vmassol> (at this point in time)  
10:35 <vmassol> from a community pov  
10:35 <vmassol> xwiki dev team = committers of the xwiki github organization  
10:36 <vmassol> it would be nice if it were  
10:36 <vmassol> and folded into the platform  
10:36 <vmassol> but it's more work and there's so much stuff to do...  
10:38 <martinus-> of course, I know, we're all in this kind of stuff :)  
10:40 <martinus-> the support we had at the time wasn't supporting anything else but "XWiki Development Team", this is one of the reason we've stopped as in the end it wasn't so useful for our usage.  
10:42 <martinus-> and we're using the money in another manner, that is more productive in the end for us and for xwiki  
10:43 <martinus-> Q: how do I get to the xwiki source code for vX.y.Z ?  
10:46 <vmassol> good point  
10:46 <vmassol> evalica: have we lost this feature?  
10:46 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <vmassol> I remember we have source code before on the download page (AFAIR)  
10:47 <vmassol> martinus-: you need to click "other version" on the download page  
10:47 <vmassol> it's quite hidden now  
10:47 <vmassol> it leads to https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Download/DownloadOther/  
10:47 <vmassol> but it doesn't answer your question :)  
10:47 <evalica> vmassol: we have it in the "More action" menu, it's called "View source" - or form URL ?viewer=code  
10:47 <vmassol> evalica: he's not talking about this  
10:47 <evalica> aa :) sorry … wait  
10:48 <vmassol> martinus-: we don't have an aggregated source distribution actually  
10:48 <martinus-> for example if I want to search for getAttachmentVersioningStore() in xwiki 6.4.4 source code ? :)  
10:48 <vmassol> you need to get the sources from github  
10:48 <vmassol> or the various source jars from the maven repo  
10:48 <evalica> yep - more versions, there is a link on the Download page, as you said  
10:48 <vmassol> martinus-: ok for this you use github  
10:48 <vmassol> I'll update th e page  
10:49 <martinus-> vmassol, and I go on branch stable-6.4.x, got it !  
10:50 <vmassol> or to that 6.4.4 tag  
10:52 <martinus-> vmassol, thanks. I just see that with search on github "Only the default branch is considered."  
10:52 <martinus-> good to know  
10:53 <vmassol> github is crap for branch/tag siwthcing  
10:53 <martinus-> I'm gonna clone this branch to grep's  
10:57 <martinus-> (ie, git clone -b stable-6.4.x https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform.git)  
11:25 <mflorea1> vmassol, tmortagne: I'm quite surprised that the xwiki/2.1 parse strips the leading whitespace although whitespace is significant in xwiki/2.1 syntax. Is this a known bug?  
11:26 <mflorea1> https://gist.github.com/mflorea/dbf9478795c3058fc2f4ae560711949a  
11:29 <mflorea1> this is affecting the wiki editor with my changes (the wiki editor gets as input an XDOM which has the leading whitespace stripped)  
11:29 <mflorea1> this test is failing because if this http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/2547/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/WikiEditorTest/testEmptyLineAndSpaceCharactersBeforeSectionTitleIsNotRemoved/  
11:36 <tmortagne> mflorea1: I don't remember  
11:37 <vmassol> mflorea1: I think it strips the first empty white line but white space is strange  
11:38 <vmassol> checking quickly if I can find some test about this  
11:40 <tmortagne> mflorea1: I notice only now that you put back the if in DefaultVelocityManager  
11:40 <tmortagne> removing it again  
11:40 <mflorea1> ok  
11:41 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/blob/66699501ea1841bc05dcf1d1e2cc19a45dee27c4/xwiki-rendering-integration-tests/src/test/resources/simple/misc/misc1.test  
11:41 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/blob/66699501ea1841bc05dcf1d1e2cc19a45dee27c4/xwiki-rendering-integration-tests/src/test/resources/simple/misc/misc2.test  
11:41 <vmassol> so we do remove the first empty line  
11:41 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/blob/66699501ea1841bc05dcf1d1e2cc19a45dee27c4/xwiki-rendering-integration-tests/src/test/resources/simple/misc/misc3.test  
11:41 <vmassol> at beginning and end  
11:42 <vmassol> actually 2  
11:42 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/blob/66699501ea1841bc05dcf1d1e2cc19a45dee27c4/xwiki-rendering-integration-tests/src/test/resources/simple/misc/misc4.test  
11:42 <vmassol> I don't see any test rgearding stripping a white space at beginning  
11:42 <vmassol> testing locally  
11:44 <tmortagne> mflorea1: I just have to revert https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/1b92e050f06542ccfa7ce09f125a86102ac28fe5 ?  
11:44 <vmassol> works for me mflorea1 so you must have a different input than me  
11:44 <vmassol> here's what i did:  
11:44 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/3cae085a4705500af427b8313304a2c7  
11:45 <mflorea1> tmortagne: you could revet and we'll see if all tests pass  
11:45 <vmassol> trying your example now  
11:45 <tmortagne> mflorea1: I mean you don't have other workaround related to the if ?  
11:45 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:45 <mflorea1> try this https://gist.github.com/mflorea/dbf9478795c3058fc2f4ae560711949a  
11:45 <mflorea1> and updates  
11:45 <mflorea1> vmassol  
11:46 <vmassol> ah so  
11:46 <vmassol> I now  
11:46 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <vmassol> we strip leading white spaces before the standalone section  
11:46 <vmassol> block  
11:46 <mflorea1> ok  
11:46 <vmassol> basically we ignore what's before the =  
11:46 <vmassol> AFAIR  
11:46 <vmassol> checking the tests now  
11:47 <mflorea1> ok, then I guess we have to remove http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/2547/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/WikiEditorTest/testEmptyLineAndSpaceCharactersBeforeSectionTitleIsNotRemoved/  
11:47 <vmassol> not that's not true, just white spaces AFAIK  
11:47 <vmassol> let me confirm first  
11:47 <mflorea1> tmortagne: no, it's only that commit  
11:48 <vmassol> yep  
11:48 <vmassol> confirmed  
11:48 <vmassol> | <#HEADER\_BEGIN\_PATTERN: (<SPACE>)\* ("=")+ (<SPACE>)\* >  
11:49 <mflorea1> ok  
11:50 <mflorea1> now we need to decide whether the new behavior for the wiki editor is acceptable  
11:50 <mflorea1> before: you were editing exactly what was saved  
11:50 <mflorea1> i.e. now you are editing the normalized syntax  
11:51 <mflorea1> (similar to the way the wysiwyg editor generates normalized syntax)  
11:51 <vmassol> I don't understand, we're now normalizing when going in wiki edit mode before presenting the content to the user?  
11:51 <vmassol> AFAIR we said we didn't want this in the past  
11:52 <vmassol> any reason we're changing this?  
11:52 <vmassol> (actually we even have an issue open to keep the non-normalized content in the future if we can)  
11:52 <mflorea1> the reason is that both the wiki editor and the wysiwyg editors are "XDOM editors", so they get as input an XDOM  
11:52 <vmassol> I see…. hmmm  
11:53 <vmassol> so that probably need a vote/proposal on the list I'd say, it's not a very small thing  
11:53 <mflorea1> the main reason for this was to be able to associate editors to data types  
11:53 <vmassol> ok, I understand  
11:53 <vmassol> but  
11:53 <vmassol> we coudl associate with String no?  
11:54 <mflorea1> sure  
11:54 <vmassol> (instead of XDOM)  
11:54 <tmortagne> if you associate with string you can't have plain text editor  
11:54 <vmassol> yep so we have to decide what we prefer  
11:55 <mflorea1> tmortagne: why?  
11:55 <tmortagne> when you save the content always been normalized anyway so I don't really see the issue  
11:55 <vmassol> what I don't like is that this generates spurious diffs  
11:55 <mflorea1> it's not normalized, it's saved as is  
11:55 <mflorea1> (because you can write bad syntax)  
11:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: only for wysiwyg not wiki  
11:56 <mflorea1> and we need to preserver that bad syntax as is  
11:56 <tmortagne> ha you are talking about wiki editor, I missed that part  
11:58 <vmassol> if the issue is only technical we could have another object wrapping a String for the wiki editor  
11:58 <vmassol> WikiContent for example  
11:58 <vmassol> it would just hold a String  
11:58 <mflorea1> my implementation allows use to have categories of editors for a data type. For XDOM we have Text and WYSIWYG categories. Moreover it support subcategories. So we could have String data type with "Wiki Syntax" categories, and Text and Wysiwyg as subcagories  
11:58 <vmassol> ah ok even better then :)  
11:59 <vmassol> I'd be in favor of not changing the wiki editor behavior at least not now in RC1  
11:59 <vmassol> we can open a dsicussion for that  
11:59 <vmassol> but I fear we may not want to normalize  
12:00 <tmortagne> I would really prefer a more descriptive type than String  
12:00 <mflorea1> we could keep the XDOM editor for when we want to get an editor for XDOM, and use string for edit mode  
12:01 <mflorea1> it's like the same editor would implement multiple roles, Editor<XDOM> and Editor<String>  
12:02 <vmassol> and we can easily use a wrpaping object if need be such as WikiContent if thomas doesn't like String  
12:02 <vmassol> (doesn't like = have something more descriptive)  
12:03 <vmassol> WikiContent, WikiText, etc  
12:04 <mflorea1> or WikiMarkup https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiki\_markup  
12:04 <vmassol> yep  
12:05 <mflorea1> but I'm fine with WikiContent or WikiText  
12:05 <tmortagne> WikiMarkup sounds more "standard"
